DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to explore the effectiveness of 3D printing in small pulmonary nodule localization by the design of an assisted device to facilitate the localization procedure.
DOC.brief_title: Application of 3D Printing Technique in Small Pulmonary Nodule Localization
DOC.detailed_description: Patient recruitment : The chest CT was reviewed by two experienced doctors to determine whether the patient was suitable for localization. data collection and management: The data was collected and reviewed by a specialized researcher and to reduce heterogenicity. The following data were collected: age , sex, nodule size,location,density,distance to the pleura,radiation dose, localization time,complications and pathologic results. data analysis: statistical analysis was performed with SPSS 22.0. Fisher exact test was used for comparison between two groups. Mann-Whitney U test was used for numeric variables. P<0.05 was considered significant.
DOC.criteria: 1. Aged from 19 to 80 years 2. lesions located in peripheral lung tissue which can be removed by wedge resection 3. The maximum diameter of the lesion is no more than 20mm 4. Examination showed no metastasis;5.Informed consent was signed voluntarily. 1. lesions located under scapula covered area 2. patients could not cooperate during the process.
